Subsection.Text: A society may provide the following contractual benefits:

Paragraph.Text: Monument or tombstone benefits to the memory of deceased members; and
Such other benefits as authorized for life insurers and which are not inconsistent with this chapter.

Subsection.Text: A society shall specify in its rules those members and their dependents or persons in whom a member has an insurable interest who may be issued, or covered by, the contractual benefits set forth in subsection (1). A society may provide benefits on the lives of children under the minimum age for adult membership upon application of an adult person.
